WorkItem.ClosedComment: Not possible due to the security restrictions put in place by Silverlight.
WorkItem.Description: In both the offline and online versions, the File dropdown has a "Save" but not a "Save As...". The functionality of the "Save" entry is what you'd expect from "Save As..." (i.e. it prompts you to choose a file name), even if you've loaded an existing character file.
WorkItem.Summary: Silverlight: File->Save is really Save As
